page.title: 04LANDCOVER
page.content: The land is covered with farmland,woodland,grassland and scrub. Almost the entire length of the cliffs is woodland.In the south-west corner of the block there is a water tower,it is south of the A39.Built in 1952 it has a capacity of 172,000 gallons,but it is no longer a service reservoir and has been by-passed.It suffered from leakage.A new service reservoir built in the Hobby Drive,caters for the needs of Clovelly village.London Lodge,on the opposite side of the A39 from the water tower,was probably an old hunting lodge.It was refurbished in 1911.A private approach path runs through the archway into woodland northwards to the Hobby Drive.The nearby farm Burnstone, takes in Eastacott which was once seperate.
